articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
R can be fun to teach and learn.
I have planned these lessons to teach my lovely year 9 girls who are very enthusiastic to learn how to build their website using R coding.
The steps are easy to follow and simple.

articles.contents:
We are delighted to announce that we have set up a worldwide network to promote the use of R - a leading data science programming language - in secondary schools for girls.
Visit our website

articles.title: Lessons
articles.contents: Contents Lesson 1 Learning Objectives Step 1: Sign in on Posit Cloud using school email Step 2: Open GitHub account Step 3: Name your repository Step 4: Clone repo and open new project on R Step 5: Setup R Step 6: Install distill package Step 7: Create website Lesson 2 Learning objectives: Step 1: Choose layout Step 2: Delete old index file Step 3: Create template for Homepage Step 4: Writing text on Homepage Lesson 3 Learning objectives: Step 1: Add images to R Step 2: Change main picture on your Homepage Step 3: To insert emoji Lesson 4 Learning objectives: Step 1: Adding more pages to your website Step 2: Add icons to buttons Step 3: To push to Github (going ONLINE) Lesson 5 Learning objectives: Stage 1: Create new theme -> css file Step 2: Change your font Step 3: Choose color palette Step 4: Saving Changes Lesson 6 Learning objectives: Step 1: Change colour of biggest font Step2: To change button colours Step 3: Menu bar (dropdown) Step 4: Add table of contents Lesson 1 Learning Objectives Opening an account at GitHub Opening a new repository and naming it Getting code from Github and creating a new R project Installing package (‚Äúdistill‚Äù) Creating website Step 1: Sign in on Posit Cloud using school email Step 2: Open GitHub account Open an account with GitHub. Go to your repositories and ceate a new repository Step 3: Name your repository Be CAREFUL as this name will be part of your website Tick the box to ‚ÄòAdd a README file‚Äô Step 4: Clone repo and open new project on R Click on the green code button and copy URL Go to R positcloud and open new project (from Git Repository) Paste in the code that you copied at GitHub Step 5: Setup R Open Project and change appearance. Tools-> global options > Appearance (Optional)If you want to see your changes in R instead of new window Tools-> global options > R Markdown > show output preview in ‚ÄúViewer Pane‚Äù Step 6: Install distill package Close and open project again Install ‚Äúdistill‚Äù using this code (type in console) install.packages("distill") click ENTER Then type this code library(distill) click ENTER Go to packages (bottom right pane) and check if there is a ‚Äòtick‚Äô next to the distill box Step 7: Create website Copy and paste this code in consule making sure you write the name of your website create_website(dir = ".", title ="name of your website", gh_pages = TRUE) Example: Click ‚ÄòENTER‚Äô to run code click Build (in top right window) and then Build Website Your website is now ready to view. We will learn about layouts in the next lesson. ## Lesson 2 Learning objectives: Find a good layout for your website homepage Change the title at yml Add text on homepage Step 1: Choose layout Choose a layout/template from this website Seankross postcards Add this code to console: install.packages("postcards") Step 2: Delete old index file Tick index.rmd in Files tab (bottom right window) Delete index.rmd file Step 3: Create template for Homepage Add this code to console with your chosen template name for example: create_article(file ="index", template= "trestles", package = "postcards") Click on index.rmd from the Files tab (bottom right window) Now go to top left window Copy this code and paste after output in a new line: site: distill::distill_website ‚Ä¢ This creates the template for the homepage ‚Ä¢ Change title ‚Ä¢ KNIT to see a preview of the homepage Step 4: Writing text on Homepage Now add all your info on your Homepage Change layout of page using these symbols For title (bigger font) use # biggest ,## smaller, ### smaller For bold use ** before and after ** For italics use * before and after * Lesson 3 Learning objectives: Add video link and images to homepage Add emoji to website Step 1: Add images to R On your computer desktop make a new folder called ‚ÄúImages‚Äù. Add all the images you want to use. Change the folder into a compressed folder. Now in your R Positcloud go to bottom right window and click Upload Choose the Images Compressed folder. Now you can use all your pictures in R Step 2: Change main picture on your Homepage Go to index.rmd In the top right window you can see ‚Äúimage:‚Äù Change image by writing down the name of folder >slash > name of image > dot > format of image. ( in between the speech marks) Example To add picture on any page use this format: ![title of image](images/name of pic.jpg) Add video (from YouTube) to R Open a Youtube video Click ‚Äúshare‚Äù and then ‚Äúembed‚Äù then copy code Add code to your page Step 3: To insert emoji Run this code in console (bottom left window) install.packages("devtools") Click ENTER then this code: devtools::install_github("hadley/emo") Now you can add emoji like this: `r emo::ji("smile")` For more emoji names visit this page click Build (in top right window) and then Build Website Lesson 4 Learning objectives: Add new pages to your website Add icons to buttons Push changes to Github Step 1: Adding more pages to your website Go to site.yml Now copy ( text and href) of ‚Äòabout‚Äô Paste underneath and rename it EXAMPLE: Use this code to make new page create_article("name") The name you use needs to be exactly the same as ‚Äúhref‚Äù name Write the title of this page in the top left window KNIT Step 2: Add icons to buttons Go to index.rmd file In the top left window now change the code from ‚Äúlabel‚Äù like this - label: ' Twitter' url: 'https://twitter.com/R_Girls_School target="_blank"' - label: ' GitHub' url: 'https://github.com/R-Girls target="_blank"' - label: ' Contact Us' url: "mailto:maryam.nawaz@greenoak.bham.sch.uk" Now Knit and see changes ‚ÄúTarget=_blank‚Äù makes sure that the link opens in a new tab (window) For more icons-> Go to website, search and copy code between the <> marks Keep clicking Knit to see changes Click Build (in top right window) and then Build Website Step 3: To push to Github (going ONLINE) Enter the following code in console install.packages("usethis") click ENTER Now enter this code into console using your login details with Github usethis::use_git_config(user.name= "your user name",user.email= "your email") Enter in console usethis::create_github_token() and get token from Github (90 days) Now paste this code into console gitcreds::gitcreds_set() Enter password or token: insert password here Save this code somewhere as you might need it again later. Now go to Git ( top right window) -> click on commit Tick all the boxes Add a message and click commit -> and then Click push Your website should have updated on Github. Go to check on Github.com On Github website: Go to settings -> Pages -> change branch main to /docs Then view your website as its ONLINE now. Lesson 5 Learning objectives: Create a css file for theme Import google fonts Import colours for layout Stage 1: Create new theme -> css file Add this code to console create_theme("my-theme") On _site.yml add line of code after output_dir: theme: my_theme.css Step 2: Change your font Import google fonts from this website Search for fav font and select @import Copy the code in between the style tags < style> Now add at the top of css file all the fonts you want to use. Customise !!!! Always knit to see changes until you are happy with font type and size Step 3: Choose color palette Go to coolers website Make a palette and download for later use. You can lock colors you like or press space bar for new colors You can export to pdf (HEX and RGB) To make changes go to your css file : Example - Title size = 28px (How big do you want the title to be?) Text color = What colour do you want the text to be? Text size = 28px (size of text) Hover color = white (when you move mouse over the writing what colour should it change into) Background color = #C34A79 (The colour of the banner) ExampleStep 4: Saving Changes After making all the changes you want save on github click Build (in top right window) and then Build Website Commit- push to save on website as mentioned above Lesson 6 Learning objectives: Changing the font colours Change button colours Include a navigation bar Add table of contents Step 1: Change colour of biggest font Copy this code at the bottom of css file h1 { color: #C34A79; font-size: 36px; } Now you can change the colour and font size of your biggest font on website Step2: To change button colours Copy this code underneath .btn-outline-dark { background-color: transparent; color: rgba(195, 74, 121); border: 1px solid; border-color: rgba(195, 74, 121); } .btn-outline-dark:hover { background-color: rgba(195, 74, 121); border-color: rgba(195, 74, 121); color: white; } Now you change colours of button using coolers.co website. Also look at R Grilsgithub for further codes. Step 3: Menu bar (dropdown) Go to _site.yml The menu argument allows you to add dropdown options in the header Make sure the spaces are properly formatted or you‚Äôll get an error (even one tab off on menu as example) Note: the links won‚Äôt work yet because we haven‚Äôt created the pages yet ExampleStep 4: Add table of contents Add this code at the top of your page toc: true toc_depth: 3 toc_float: true toc means table of content toc_depth is the the differet levels of headers you used click Build (in top right window) and then Build Website Push all changes to Github Hope you enjoyed making your new website with R üòÑ
